title: Duplin County Airport
text:
Duplin County Airport is a county-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> in <a href="Duplin%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina">Duplin County, North Carolina</a>, United States. It is located two <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (4 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) northwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Kenansville%2C%20North%20Carolina">Kenansville, North Carolina</a>. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Although most U.S. airports use the same three-letter <a href="location%20identifier">location identifier</a> for the <a href="Federal%20Aviation%20Administration">FAA</a> and <a href="International%20Air%20Transport%20Association">IATA</a>, this airport is assigned DPL by the FAA but has no designation from the IATA (which assigned DPL to <a href="Dipolog%20Airport">Dipolog Airport</a> in <a href="Dipolog%20City">Dipolog City</a>, <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a>).
History.
Duplin County Airport opened December 16, 1964 when a University of North Carolina Medical School airplane landed on the runway.
Facilities and aircraft.
Duplin County Airport covers an area of 435 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (176 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 137 feet (42 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 5/23 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 6,002 by 75 feet (1,829 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending August 25, 2011, the airport had 17,500 aircraft operations, an average of 47 per day: 2% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 98% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. MCAS New River uses the airport as an OLF. At that time there were 21 aircraft based at this airport: 67% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>, 19% <a href="jet%20aircraft">jet</a>, 9% multi-engine, and 5% <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a>.
